amendment.description: Amendment sought to maintain the status quo for all the donor States by including earmarks and Projects of National and Regional Significance in the scope of number of programs covered in the Minimum Guarantee program.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 23 printed in House Report 108-456 to include "high priority" projects (projects requested by members) and projects contained in the bill's new projects of "regional and national significance" program in the within the minimum guarantee of funds that would be provided to eachstate. (This is consistent with current law; the bill removes these projects from the calculation.) In addition, the amendment clarifies that the money saved by this change in the calculation would be returned to the core highway programs, including Interstate Maintenance, National Highway System, bridges, Surface Transportation, and Congestion.
